subpoena.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a written order to come to a court of law and be a witness
subpoena.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to order someone to come to a court of law and be a witness
subpoena.translation[1].definitions[0].e: James was subpoenaed as a witness.
subpoena.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to order someone to come to court and be a witness, or to order someone to give documents to the court
subpoena.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Telephone companiesâ€™ records can be subpoenaed.
We will subpoena him to give evidence.
subpoena.translation[3].definitions[0].d: a document ordering someone to come to court and be a witness, or ordering someone to give documents to the court
subpoena.translation[3].definitions[0].e: The regulators issued a subpoena for documents relating to 23 company audits.
